You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
INDUSTRY INTEGRATION SOLUTIONS
Industry Integration Solutions

To address end-to-end business needs, integrate Industries Cloud apps with external systems by using Industry Integration Solutions. An expansive selection of industry-specific, modular business processes are available through industry-specific APIs and integration apps that are deployed on MuleSoft CloudHub 1.0 and CloudHub 2.0. Unlike CloudHub 1.0, CloudHub 2.0 supports 12 global shared regions so that you can deploy your applications faster on a specific shared region. All shared regions are accessible to you if you have a global deployment entitlement. Otherwise, only those regions that are available to your organization are shown. If you deploy an integration on a shared space of CloudHub 2.0, you can choose to hide the value of the parameter on the MuleSoft’s Anypoint Runtime Manager.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: all editions


USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To use Industry Integration Solutions:	

Salesforce Administrator

AND

MuleSoft Administrator

The integration apps are out-of-the-box templates that include prebuilt transformations that reduce the time and cost to go live. Connect your Salesforce and MuleSoft orgs using Industry Integration Solutions to deploy the integration apps. After deploying the apps in your MuleSoft instance in Salesforce, extend them in MuleSoft Anypoint Platform based on your business needs.

Use the Industry APIs and Integrations with Industries Cloud to:

Implement digital workflows and create seamless user experiences.
Innovate with new apps by using industry-specific open APIs.
Go live faster by using the prebuilt integrations.
Reduce costs by reusing the prebuilt integrations and APIs.
Use IT assets for innovation instead of unlocking line of business (LOB) systems.
Retrieve and process data for all subsystems more easily and fluidly.

Include the Industry API add-on—available at no additional cost—in your contract to use the Industry APIs with:

Communications Cloud
Energy and Utilities Cloud
Health Cloud

Industry integrations are available for:

Automotive Cloud
Communications Cloud
Consumer Goods Cloud
Energy and Utilities Cloud
Financial Services Cloud
Health Cloud
Loyalty Cloud
Manufacturing Cloud
Media Cloud
Enable Access to Industry APIs
To enable access to Industry APIs, read and accept the terms and conditions of all the Industry Clouds that you are subscribed to. Enable access to multiple Industry clouds at once.
Enable Access to Industry Integrations
Before you connect your Salesforce and MuleSoft instances, read and accept the terms and conditions of all the Industry Clouds that you are subscribed to. Enable access to multiple Industry clouds at once.
Connect Your Salesforce and MuleSoft Instances
Securely connect your Salesforce and MuleSoft instances by logging in to your MuleSoft Anypoint Platform account or by using the credentials from a connected app in your MuleSoft instance.
Enable Integrations
An integration is a pre-built app or a configurable example. Integrations simplify the business workflow implementation by allowing external systems to easily integrate with the Industries Cloud apps. An integration can depend on several other apps that are necessary to complete a business use case. For example, an integration app that syncs orders between SAP S/4 HANA and Salesforce Manufacturing Cloud has a related System API app to connect Salesforce to the SAP S/4 HANA system. Enabling an integration configures and deploys an instance of the integration and its dependent apps in your MuleSoft instance. Enable an integration multiple times to create multiple instances of the same integration.
Re-enable a Failed Integration Instance
Re-enable a failed instance of an integration.
Delete an Integration Instance
Remove an integration instance that you no longer need from your Salesforce org and MuleSoft Runtime Manager.
Update Integrations to the Latest Version
Enable integrations access to multiple Industry Clouds that you are subscribed to, without resetting the MuleSoft instance connection.
Reset MuleSoft Instance Connection
Resetting the MuleSoft instance connection disconnects the MuleSoft instance from Salesforce, and you’ll no longer be able to view the published integrations in your Salesforce org. After you reset, the deployed integrations are available only in the MuleSoft instance.
Disable Access to Industry APIs and Integrations
Disable the Industry APIs to remove access to them. Decline the terms and conditions to remove access to Integrations.
Update Access to Integrations
Enable integrations access to multiple Industry Clouds that you are subscribed to, without resetting the MuleSoft instance connection.
Extend Your Integration App
After deploying an integration app in your MuleSoft instance, you can extend the app in MuleSoft Anypoint Studio to meet your end-to-end business needs.
View Integrations in Private Exchange
If you have developed and published your own integrations in your MuleSoft instance, you can view the integrations in Private Exchange.
Common Setup Errors
See the common errors that you can encounter during the Integration Solutions setup and the possible reasons and resolutions.
